revised_title: Oxygen Absorption and Respiration in Blood
tldr: The author conducted experiments to investigate the absorption of oxygen by blood and its connection with respiration and animal heat. They found that blood can absorb oxygen independently of putrefaction and that the absorption of oxygen causes a change in the color of the blood. The author also investigated the presence of carbonic acid gas in the residual air and found that it was not present in significant amounts. These findings contribute to the understanding of the role of blood in respiration and animal heat regulation.
